Content:: This article documents the chronology and epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 in April 2020, the virus which causes the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and is responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic. The first human cases of COVID-19 were identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. WHO Situation Report 72:[1] WHO Situation Report 73:[16] WHO Situation Report 74:[37] WHO Situation Report 75:[53] WHO Situation Report 76:[69] WHO Situation Report 77:[82] WHO Situation Report 78:[94] WHO Situation Report 79:[105] WHO Situation Report 80:[113] WHO Situation Report 81:[120] WHO Situation Report 82:[130] WHO Situation Report 83:[140] WHO Situation Report 84:[149] WHO Situation Report 85:[165] WHO Situation Report 86:[173] WHO Situation Report 87:[180] WHO Situation Report 88:[192] WHO Situation Report 89:[203] WHO Situation Report 90:[214] WHO Situation Report 91:[223] WHO Situation Report 92:[232] WHO Situation Report 93:[243] WHO Situation Report 94:[253] WHO Situation Report 95:[265] WHO Situation Report 96:[274] WHO Situation Report 97:[281] WHO Situation Report 98:[291] WHO Situation Report 99:[298] WHO Situation Report 100:[309] WHO Situation Report 101:[316] Countries and territories that confirmed their first cases during April 2020: By 30 April, the following countries and territories had not reported any cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections: Africa Asia Europe Oceania
Title: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in April 2020 - Wikipedia
